title: Simplify README for new users
body:
Visualizing all of our postcommit tests in the README page of the repo probably does not help those interested in them, and some would argue it addes noise (@johnjcasey ) I propose we reduce the amount of info we're showing here. Thoughts? @aromanenko-dev @kennknowles @iemejia ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12164]: Fixes SpannerChangeStreamIT
body:
The GSON object was being initialized in a static context. When the DoFn that used it was called in another JVM, which did not initialized this object, we were getting a NPE exception.

Here, we move the initialization of the GSON object inside the DoFn itself (through a setup method).

title: [BEAM-13159] Update embedded-redis dependency
body:
The io.oden/embedded-redis artifact was provided by me as part of landing BEAM-13159, as the previously used version did not use a recent enough version of Redis to support the XADD/XRANGE command set and also had a fatal crash bug on darwin/arm64 ("Apple Silicon"). My fork in turn was based on the signal.org artifact, which had a more recent redis version but was still affected by the crash bug. Now that https://github.com/signalapp/embedded-redis/pull/12 has landed, the io.oden artifact is unlikely to be upgraded further; beam should use the dependency that is actively maintained. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11095] Better error handling for iter/reiter/multimap
body:
This is a continuation of the work started in #16776 Right now, when we have an iter/reiter/multimap function that uses a nested type with a non-concrete type somewhere in it, we don't give a very clear error - e.g., if we tried to define the following pardo: ``` type nestedNonConcreteType struct { Ghi func(string) string } type nonConcreteType struct { Abc string Def nestedNonConcreteType } func (f *extractFn) ProcessElement(ctx context.Context, line string, multimap func(string) func(*nonConcreteType) bool) { ``` we get the following error: ``` panic: inserting ParDo in scope root/CountWords constructing DoFn invalid DoFn caused by: method ProcessElement invalid caused by: bad parameter type for reflect.methodValueCall: func(string) func(*main.nonConcreteType) bool ``` This updates the error handling to be: ``` panic: inserting ParDo in scope root/CountWords constructing DoFn invalid DoFn caused by: method ProcessElement invalid caused by: bad parameter type for reflect.methodValueCall: func(string) func(*main.nonConcreteType) bool caused by: Output of a multimap must be valid iter type caused by: All parameters in an iter must be universal type, container type, or concrete type caused by: Nested type in struct "main.nonConcreteType" not permitted in concrete types. caused by: Nested type in struct "main.nestedNonConcreteType" not permitted in concrete types. caused by: Type "func(string) string" of kind "func" not permitted in concrete types. All types must be serializable. ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12920] Assume that bare generator types define simple generators
body:
Assume that bare generator types define simple generators.
The only type of generators that Beam type inference currently handles are simple generators: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/d7ee6b8c8b4fedb05d31d6554ab55a6d4bca0356/sdks/python/apache_beam/typehints/typehints.py#L1120

This test started to fail on Python 3.9 because bare Generator instances on Python <3.9 were not truly 'bare' and still had `__args__` defined:
 ```
> python3.7
>>> import typing
>>> typing.Generator.__args__
(+T_co, -T_contra, +V_co)
```
, so we inferred a type for bare generators as Generator[T_co, T_contra,  V_co] and didn't fail. Preserving this behavior for Python 3.9+ as well, but setting the last two type variables to `None`, since we are ignoring them later, otherwise they add an extra warning.

title: [BEAM-13860] Make `DoFn.infer_output_type` return element type
body:
This is technically a breaking change, but I think it's a safe one as I don't expect many people are overriding `DoFn.infer_output_type`. I looked for instances of this in internal Google code, and there's only one such case. Funnily enough, it actually respects _this_ proposed API, and returns the element type, not `Iterable[element_type]`. This is also true for the place we override it in `apache_beam.dataframe.schemas`, previously that code had a workaround to deal with the improper handling, which can now be removed. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-11095] Better error handling for illegal emit functions
body:
Right now, when we have an emit function that takes in a nested type with a non-concrete type somewhere in it, we don't give a very clear error - e.g., if we tried to define the following pardo: ``` type nestedEmitType struct { Ghi func(string) string } type emitType struct { Abc string Def nestedEmitType } func (f *extractFn) ProcessElement(ctx context.Context, line string, emit func(emitType)) { ... Do stuff ... } ``` right now we get this error ``` panic: inserting ParDo in scope root/CountWords constructing DoFn invalid DoFn caused by: method ProcessElement invalid caused by: bad parameter type for reflect.methodValueCall: func(main.emitType) ``` This updates to give a much clearer error - e.g. for the same case with these changes: ``` panic: inserting ParDo in scope root/CountWords constructing DoFn invalid DoFn caused by: method ProcessElement invalid caused by: bad parameter type for reflect.methodValueCall: func(main.emitType) caused by: All parameters in an emit must be universal type, container type, or concrete type caused by: Nested type in struct "main.emitType" not permitted in concrete types. caused by: Nested type in struct "main.nestedEmitType" not permitted in concrete types. caused by: Type "func(string) string" of kind "func" not permitted in concrete types. All types must be serializable. ``` In the name of small prs/quick feedback, I decided to put this up before handling similar cases for Iter/ReIter/MultiMap (right now just represented as a TODO), once this is in I'll apply a similar approach to them. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: DataflowRunner: Experiment added to disable unbounded PCcollection checks turning batch into streaming
body:
There are IOs where the previous logic detected them as unbounded thereforce enforced streaming behaviour when the pipeline itself should be considered as batch. For example `KafkaIO.withStopReadTime` always launches as streaming, meanwhile it's actually a limited amount of data. Until proper detection has been implemented, this is a workaround to let developers who know when a pipeline should actually be batch can override the built-in streaming enforcing. See https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15951 for further context and original "trigger" for this contribution. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12697] Add primitive field generation from IR to SBE extension
body:
This gets a basic schema representation started to the SBE extension. It focuses on IR, since it's easier to work with and is in the most immediate need. It's technically possible to generate a Beam schema and `PayloadSerializer` from this, but I'm saving that for a future PR. Otherwise, this works with very simple schemas. This doesn't translate directly to a Beam schema, since using an IR doesn't support encoding (i.e. there's an `OtfDecoder` but no `OtfEncoder`, which is understandable). If we ever get a request to do SBE encoding from an IR, we'll need to implement it ourselves, so this is set up to easily start tracking additional info if it ever comes to that. The decision was also made to let users set how to handle unsigned types, which is a deviation from the original plan, but I don't think it was ever firmly established if forcing a higher bit count was acceptable. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13563] Introducing common AWS ClientBuilderFactory (AWS Sdk v2)
body:
The new client builder factory makes all existing provider APIs obsolete, these are in fact now implemented in terms of the new factory. Respective old APIs got deprecated. Benefits: - User facing APIs become independent of what client types are used (e.g. additional Cloudwatch integration, async or sync, ...) - Respects existing AwsOptions (regions, credentials, proxy, http config, ...) if set, but users may always configure AWS IOs individually. - A retry configuration is pushed down into the AWS client via the factory ([BEAM-13206]) - Finally consistent configuration options between all AWS IOs, including the S3FileSystem. - If needed, the factory class can be changed using AwsOptions to allow for a custom implementation. - One well tested place supporting the various possible configuration options. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Use default context output rather than outputWithTimestamp for ElasticsearchIO
body:
Using `ProcessContext#outputWithTimestamp` is more fragile than `output`, and explicit use of `outputWithTimestamp` is not required in the case of ES module; in fact, code is currently trying to emulate `output` by storing and recalling element timestamps. This change is being made after finding an issue with timestamp validation when starting a pipeline from a snapshot that could have been avoided with this change. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13812] Integrate DataprocClusterManager into Interactive Environment
body:
- Integrates the DataprocClusterManager previously introduced in: - [[BEAM-13799] Create an Interactive Beam Dataproc package for users to manage clusters with](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/16691) - Adds code to automatically create a Dataproc cluster configured with Docker and Flink if a user instantiates an InteractiveRunner using underlying_runner='FlinkRunner' - By default, the created Dataproc cluster will be called 'interactive-beam-cluster' and will be cleaned up when the Interactive Environment is interrupted - Introduces the Clusters class in interactive_beam.py, which acts as a user interface that provides the user with the following capabilities: - Changing the default name of the clusters created by Interactive Beam - Cleaning up a cluster by providing a corresponding pipeline, an option to force the deletion is provided, in the case where more than one pipeline use the same cluster - Getting all pipelines that use the provided master_url - Receiving a description back for either the cluster corresponding to a specific pipeline, or the descriptions of all pipelines - ASF Jira thread: [[Beam-13812]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-13812) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. body:
Right now stale bot is not running correctly - it looks like it stopped working around a year ago (last pr I could find with stale bot activity). I'm guessing this was unintentional and caused by probot not being supported anymore, just like the pr labeler (see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-13779) As a consequence of this breakage, we have a lot of stale prs that have been around for a while. As of the writing of this issue, we have 218 prs in the repo, with 129 older than 60 days old (59% stale assuming these don't have more recent activity). This makes the repo feel less active and makes it harder to see the legitimate PRs that have fallen through the cracks. This fixes the problem by adding the GitHub stale action ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13647] Use role for Go worker binary.
body:
Move away from older version of Go Worker Binary, in favour of a dedicated RoleUrn. 1. Adds "beam:artifact:role:go_worker_binary:v1" urn to proto. 2. On pipeline execution, updates the default Go env in the pipeline proto with the worker binary, as appropriate: * Continue to use file references for universal runners * Start using URL types pointing to GCS staging location for Dataflow. 3. Retain legacy logic in case of old SDKs using newer SDK container for some reason. 4. Newer SDKs can still use older SDK containers as there's no simple mechanism at present to add additional dependencies to the Go environment. Therefore there's often only 1 dependency and it will always be the worker. However, from 2.37.0 on, the role will be usable and expected. Validated "old container" behavior manually against Spark and Dataflow, with the pipelines successfully executing with each. Minor breaking change to the dataflow lib, unexporting the StageFile function, and also have it return the SHA256 hash for the binary. dataflowlib was never intended to be used outside of the dataflow runner code anyway. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13823] Update docs for SnowflakeIO
body:
The documentation for SnowflakeIO has some bugs and it does not describe a few things very well. I would like to make the following changes: - Fix code examples (!!) - Add information about the need to add a maven package. - Add links to other resources i.e. SnowflakeIO source code, SnowflakeIO Javadoc/pydoc, Snowflake docs - Describe more precisely the `Snowflake.DataSourceConfiguration` object configuration for the different authentication methods. - Add section about current limitations - Improve file syntax In the coming weeks, I will want to introduce more changes, but current changes seem crucial to me. - I also had to turn off syntax highlighting as a temporary workaround as this guide does not yet follow the projects convention. We have separate documentation for Python and Java, which causes the code blocks to not display properly. I will be hardening the Python SDK in the near future and then I will also improve the documentation structure. This is my first contribution to this project, so if I did something inconsistent with the adopted process, I will be happy to hear about it. PS. Can I ask for io-python-snowflake component in JIRA? Internal tracker: SNOW-539549 R: @sfc-gh-pgancz, @sfc-gh-takidau, @takidau, @melap **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13024] Unify PipelineOptions behavior
body:
Right now, in the Go Sdk the Google Cloud Dataflow runner automatically populates PipelineOptions with a subset of the Command Line flags that a user passes in when running a pipeline, but all other runners do not. This document proposes unifying Go runners’ treatment of PipelineOptions so that by default each runner will populate PipelineOptions with all Command Line flags. We will still give each runner the ability to mask some subset of those flags. Full design doc here - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AyO5SDEd_DzyOyrz_TkyDLUv19eLsKI97vKM8I7fQ9o/edit#heading=h.wskna8eurvjv For manual testing beyond the automated one I added, I ran this on the direct/dataflow/universal runners with a pipeline that just prints out the PipelineOptions key/values **Direct runner** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/152418756-ec8edc28-f6c7-42af-a48c-a91044a3954d.png) **Spark (universal) runner** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/152418853-5269858f-7e96-4dac-ab0d-af8cd481c0ec.png) **Dataflow PipelineOptions in the console** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/152418918-0d1bf9c7-cd40-4504-833a-d0b4e0409bab.png) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution!
